title: BJP Uttar Pradesh
subtitle:
Myth Buster: Citizenship Amendment Act 2019

It is only a Constitutional process to give citizenship to those who were denied basic rights for the last 70 years. It aims to target genuine refugees and not intruders. #IndiaSupportsCAApic.twitter.com/GuRViRoJXz

title: Advocate Vershathakur81
subtitle:
#IndiaSupportsCAA because CAA is about giving citizenship to persecuted refugees & not about taking anyone’s citizenship away.

title: KUMAR TAPAS
subtitle: Pushing forward India's historical ethos of giving refuge to the persecuted, Modi Govt passed the Citizenship Amendment Bill. Persecuted refugees from Pakistan, Afghanistan, and Bangladesh will be given Indian citizenship. #IndiaSupportsCAApic.twitter.com/K6uy7a7eeP

subtitle: The Citizenship Amendment Bill 2019 gives citizenship to refugees who have had centuries of cultural affinity with Indian ethos. #IndiaSupportsCAApic.twitter.com/9XNMmqM9CU

title: Anoop A.J.
subtitle:
CAA recognises the role each nation has to play in ensuring all human beings given a chance to live a life of dignity. India might be a non-signatory to the 1951 UN Convention on Refugees, but it has never shied away from granting asylum to those in need.
